title: Ticket #3078: bosco_stop is not stoping condor
description:
This is a BOSCO ticket. bin/bosco_stop is failing to stop BOSCO on my RHEL5 host.

I can repeat the problem. As user marco on uc3-sub: 

bosco_start
bosco_stop
Then I see the process of my BOSCO condor_master still running

I wrote a new version of the script (bosco_stop.marco) that accept "--force" as parameter. When that is provided it checks for the process running BOSCO's condor_master and kills it with SIGQUIT. This worked in stopping BOSCO's condor_master.

The file is attached. If notify via email Jaime (with Todd and Derek in CC)

Best, Marco

If we decide we need a backstop of /bin/kill, then we should use the -pid argument when starting condor_master and consult that file for which pid to kill.
